logicalTable.name: D3 Orders (Facts Attributes)
logicalTable.description:
This logical table contains the attribute columns that are present in the Revenue fact table which are not measure columns but can be used as attributes in the report. 
All the columns in this table are physically mapped to columns in the Revenue fact table, or are derived calculations from these objects.

logicalColumns.name: Order Number
logicalColumns.description: Returns the Oder Number from the Revenue Facts table

expressionObjects: physicalColumn:Sample App Lite Data.F10 Revenue Facts (Order grain).Order_Number

logicalColumns.name: Order Status
logicalColumns.description: Returns the Oder Status value from the Revenue Facts table.  Naturally drills into Orders Number Column.

expressionObjects: physicalColumn:Sample App Lite Data.F10 Revenue Facts (Order grain).Order_Status

logicalColumns.name: Order Type
logicalColumns.description: Returns the Oder Type value from the Revenue Facts table. Naturally drills into Orders Status Column.

expressionObjects: physicalColumn:Sample App Lite Data.F10 Revenue Facts (Order grain).Order_Type

logicalColumns.name: Order Size Bin
logicalColumns.description: This is a logical calculation object that buckets the order by their size (revenue per order). The calculation is done on the fly by OBIEE server and results in 5 buckets.

physicalExpression.expressionTemplate: CASE  WHEN %1 < 1000 THEN 'Below 1k' WHEN %1 < 2000 THEN 'Between 1k and 2k' WHEN %1 < 3000 THEN 'Between 2k and 3k' WHEN %1 < 5000 THEN 'Between 3k and 5k' ELSE 'Over 5k' END
expressionObjects: physicalColumn:Sample App Lite Data.F10 Revenue Facts (Order grain).Revenue

logicalColumns.name: Order to Bill Days
logicalColumns.description: This is a logical calculation object that computes for ech order, the number of days between order date and bill date.

logicalColumns.name: Order to Bill Days Bin
logicalColumns.description: This is a logical calculation object that buckets each order into a group, based on the number of days between order date and bill date. The calculation is done on the fly by BIEE server.

logicalExpression.expressionTemplate: CASE  WHEN %1 < 10 THEN 'Below 10' WHEN %1 < 15 THEN 'Between 10 and 15' WHEN %1 < 20 THEN 'Between 15 and 20' ELSE 'Over 20' END
expressionObjects: logicalColumn:SampleApp Lite.D3 Orders (Facts Attributes).Order to Bill Days

logicalColumns.name: Order Date
logicalColumns.description: Returns the Oder Date value from the Revenue Facts table. This field is of type Date.

expressionObjects: physicalColumn:Sample App Lite Data.F10 Revenue Facts (Order grain).Order_Day_Dt

logicalColumns.name: Order Month
logicalColumns.description: Extracts the month out of the the Oder Date value from the Revenue Facts table. This information is extracted by BIEE server.

expressionObjects: physicalColumn:Sample App Lite Data.F10 Revenue Facts (Order grain).Order_Day_Dt

logicalColumns.name: Order Year
logicalColumns.description: Extracts the year out of the the Oder Date value from the Revenue Facts table. This information is extracted by BIEE server.

expressionObjects: physicalColumn:Sample App Lite Data.F10 Revenue Facts (Order grain).Order_Day_Dt

logicalColumns.name: Billed Date
logicalColumns.description: Returns the Oder Bill Date value from the Revenue Facts table. This field is of type Date.

expressionObjects: physicalColumn:Sample App Lite Data.F10 Revenue Facts (Order grain).Bill_Day_Dt

logicalColumns.name: Billed Month
logicalColumns.description: Extracts the month out of the the Oder Bill Date value from the Revenue Facts table. This information is extracted by BIEE server.

logicalColumns.name: Billed Year
logicalColumns.description: Extracts the year out of the the Oder Bill Date value from the Revenue Facts table. This information is extracted by BIEE server.
